required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Mechanical Versus Manual Chest Compression: A Retrospective Study in In-hospital Cardiac Arrest

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the investigators compared mechanical and manual chest compressions in in-hospital cardiac arrest cases.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the investigators analyzed cardiopulmonary resuscitations performed over a 2-year period in an emergency department of a training and research hospital and compared success of manual and mechanical chest compressions in terms of return of spontaneous circulation, 30-day survival, and hospital discharge. Investigators present the study as an in-hospital cardiac arrest study; however, all of the resuscitation performed in the cases included in the study were performed in the emergency department.

primary_outcome.description: Mortality rates from the hospital admission to the 30th day

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of the return of spontaneous circulation
primary_outcome.description: Rate of return of the spontaneous circulation with duration at least five minutes

arm_group.description: Manuel chest compressions will be handled by clinicians
Mechanical chest compressions will be handled via mechanical chest compression device

intervention.intervention_name: Manuel chest compressions handled by clinicians
intervention.description: Compressions will be handled by human efforts
LUCAS-2 model piston-based mechanical chest compression device was used for mechanical chest compressions

study_pop.textblock: Cases with cardiac arrest in-hospital environment (in emergency department) and whose had manual or mechanical cardiopulmonary resuscitation in emergency department included in the study; data were collected hospital management information system and analyzed retropectively.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Over 18 age Cardiac arrest cases In-hospital cardiac arrest cases Resuscitations performed in emergency department
Exclusion Criteria:
<18 age

facility.name: Ankara Yıldırım Beyazıt University, School of Medicine, Department of Emergency Medicine

reference.citation: Couper K, Yeung J, Nicholson T, Quinn T, Lall R, Perkins GD. Mechanical chest compression devices at in-hospital cardiac arrest: A systematic review and meta-analysis. Resuscitation. 2016 Jun;103:24-31. doi: 10.1016/j.resuscitation.2016.03.004. Epub 2016 Mar 11. Review.

Couper K, Quinn T, Lall R, Devrell A, Orriss B, Seers K, Yeung J, Perkins GD; COMPRESS-RCT collaborators. Mechanical versus manual chest compressions in the treatment of in-hospital cardiac arrest patients in a non-shockable rhythm: a randomised controlled feasibility trial (COMPRESS-RCT). Scand J Trauma Resusc Emerg Med. 2018 Aug 30;26(1):70. doi: 10.1186/s13049-018-0538-6.

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to share individual participant data (IPD) with other researchers.
